ai-ud2.7:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-ud2.7:1.3_0: Now at that time a certain lay follower’s dear and beloved only child passed away.
ai-ud2.7:2.1_0: Then in the middle of the day several lay followers with wet clothes and hair went to the Buddha.
ai-ud2.7:2.1_1: After bowing down to the Buddha, they sat down,
ai-ud2.7:2.2_0: They went to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to them:
ai-ud2.7:2.3_0: “Why, lay followers, have you come here in the middle of the day with wet clothes and hair?”
ai-ud2.7:3.1_0: When that was said, that lay follower said this to the Fortunate One:
ai-ud2.7:3.2_0: “Sir, my dear and beloved only child has passed away.
ai-ud2.7:3.3_0: That’s why we came here in the middle of the day with wet clothes and hair.”
ai-ud2.7:4.1_0: Then, knowing the significance of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud2.7:5.1_0: “Hosts of gods and most human beings are bound
ai-ud2.7:5.2_0: to what seems dear and pleasant.
ai-ud2.7:5.4_0: they fall under the sway of the King of Death.
ai-ud2.7:6.1_0: Those who are loved by day and night
ai-ud2.7:6.2_0: give up what is likeable and pleasing.
ai-ud2.7:6.3_0: they are dropped at the root,
ai-ud2.7:6.4_0: Death’s bait so hard to escape.”
